name: Cuban Midnight Sandwich
author: Maruchy Ramos-Lachance
summary: This sandwich is called a 'Media Noche' which translates to 'Midnight.'  It makes a wonderful dinner sandwich because it is served hot. A nice side dish is black bean soup or black beans and rice, and plantain chips.
ingredients: ½ pound thinly sliced deli turkey meat
½ pound thinly sliced cooked ham
½ pound thinly sliced Swiss cheese
directions: In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise and Italian dressing
On each roll, arrange layers of turkey, ham, and cheese
Top each with dill pickle slices
Close sandwiches, and brush tops and bottoms with olive oil
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium high heat
Cook sandwiches for 2 minutes, pressing down with a plate covered with aluminum foil
Flip, and cook for 2 more minutes, or until cheese is melted
Remove from heat, place on plates, and cut in half diagonally
